title.value: METhodological RadiomICs Score (METRICS): a quality scoring tool for radiomics research endorsed by EuSoMII
title.justification: The title clearly indicates the main contribution of the paper, which is the development of a quality scoring tool for radiomics research called METRICS.
title.quote: METhodological RadiomICs Score (METRICS): a quality scoring tool for radiomics research endorsed by EuSoMII

extractions.description: This paper proposes a new quality scoring tool, METhodological RadiomICs Score (METRICS), designed to improve the research quality of radiomics studies. It describes the method of development using a modified Delphi study with international experts, and details the structure of the tool, including its items and categories. The paper also discusses the implementation of a web application for score calculation and encourages feedback from the research community.

type.justification: The paper primarily focuses on the development of a quality scoring tool based on expert consensus and theoretical framework rather than on empirical experiments.
type.quote: To propose a new quality scoring tool, METhodological RadiomICs Score (METRICS), to assess and improve research quality of radiomics studies.

name.justification: The paper discusses the development of a quality scoring tool specifically for use in radiomics research.
name.quote: A quality assessment tool, METhodological RadiomICs Score (METRICS), is made available by a large group of international domain experts, with transparent methodology, aiming at evaluating and improving research quality in radiomics and machine learning.

name.justification: Machine learning is mentioned as part of the radiomics research that the METRICS tool aims to assess and improve.
name.quote: A quality assessment tool, METhodological RadiomICs Score (METRICS), is made available by a large group of international domain experts, with transparent methodology, aiming at evaluating and improving research quality in radiomics and machine learning.

name.justification: The paper mentions deep learning in the context of radiomics and its inclusion in the METRICS assessment tool.
name.quote: METRICS accounts for varying use cases, from handcrafted radiomics to entirely deep learning-based pipelines.
